lexUnit.name: tuck.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: put into a snug place

sentence.text: Inwardly seething , she did as she was told , carefully tucking her dressing-gown about her legs .
Gloria tucked the blanket around Dot and kissed the tip of her nose .
The man lowered his scarf , tucking it below his chin , causing Creed to flinch at the sight of the ravaged face now caught in the shine of the moon .
It always banged on the desk top , each morning , before he remembered to tuck it below his tie .
He chose four different coloured capsules and tucked them discreetly beneath his plate .
Reaching for a napkin , Ashley tucked it beneath Thomas 's chin .
He tucked the phone between chin and shoulder and gave me a friendly salute , but did n't pause in his recitation of copy .
Fred tucked his toga between his legs like a baby 's nappy and picked his friend up .
She wiped her lips on the paper and crumpling it up , tucked it demurely between the seat and the wall .
Jamie is not the type to tuck himself in bed early .
She did turn from him then , to tuck her shirt in her waistband , and to hide the baffling tears that stung at her eyes .
He dropped the mercenary sword , tucked his axe in his belt and then strode over the cobbles to the unconscious girl .
Without tucking the shirt in his pants , he pulls a royal red tie over his head that has been pre-knotted , I 'm sure by his wife , Lonnie .
With one swift motion McGowan reached up , took the glasses off and tucked them in his pocket .
Craig tucked the books inside his coat and as the door was flung open , he strode past his open-mouthed brother and down towards the drawing-room .
Newman ignored the extended hand , looked at the man called Steve who had tucked his right hand inside the lapel of his buttoned jacket .

But in tucking a cover over the old man 's knees , for there was snow on the ground outside and in spite of a roaring fire the room was not as warm as he was used to , she felt her hand patted and then he said , ` Peace and goodwill , peace and goodwill , that is the secret after all . "
She tucked a towel round his neck , not quite managing to meet his knowing look .
Josh tucked his arm companionably through hers .
Thread the folded end through the hold and tuck the two ends through the loop .
Léonie sat up straight , tucked her feet to one side , put her hands round her knees .
He always used to tuck it underneath the water butt .
The old lady let it go , and watched Theda hastily tuck it out of sight .
Later on , younger guests stayed on for disco dancing while we walked back to our apartment to tuck our happy , tired children into bed .
Leftover carpet ( for when you reposition it ) can be tucked under the stair landing .
He tucked the handkerchief back into his sleeve .
Stok reached for his riding breeches , buttoned himself into them , tucked his shirt in , then walked across to where I was sitting .
The wolves yelped uncontrollably , throwing their riders into the mess before scampering off back to the hills their tails tucked firmly between their legs .
Take off scarves , too , while your child is playing and tuck in the dangling toggles on anoraks and jackets .
She looked at the back of Jessica 's head , tucked sideways onto Rory 's shoulder as he drove , and she smiled .
Taking small sections of hair at a time , pull your hair over the Flexi Comb and tuck under the edge .
Something I can tuck underneath my arm and use to get about with . "
Grégoire was sitting with his legs tucked firmly back , his elbows pressed against his sides .
The dishwasher has been tucked away in the central island and is opposite the main sink , so dishes can be quickly rinsed and put out of sight .
She 's still got her hat on , and her hair is all tucked up inside .
Trim the edges and tuck around the body like a skirt .
HIBS can tuck away their passports until their summer hols if they do n't beat Anderlecht at Easter Road on Tuesday night .
Not knowing what else to do , Theda first found a fresh cap and tucked away her dangerous locks , and then began to lay out her clothes , retrieving her portmanteau from under the bed .
` The perils of drink , " he murmured to Juliet , as he tucked away his stethoscope .
Ruth tucked up her skirts and clenched her teeth , and as Alfred called out the beat she pushed hard against the slippery wall , and was relieved and delighted to feel the barge moving .
She paused to tuck up a strand of her long hair which had escaped from the orange mob-cap .
While I ca n't condone this sort of cheating Mr Unce , I have found two very good methods are tucking them down your sock or writing them on your shirt cuff .
The white men took away our land , " she said tucking the coin down the front of her dirty dress , ` And now there is nowhere left to grow maize .
He wore a silk shirt with a cravat tucked in round his thin neck , and elegantly uncrumpled linen trousers .
